newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks slip in early trade on scandal worry.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks slip in early trade on scandal worry.

text.p: Tokyo stocks slipped in early morning trade on Wednesday after opening a touch higher.

The market was cautious over the expected announcement of administrative penalties against Nomura Securities Co Ltd T and Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd (DKB) in a racketeer payoff scandal and other brokerages' possible involvement, brokers said.
After 15 minutes of trade, the 225-share Nikkei average was down 47.50 points or 0.23 percent at 20,355.24. September Nikkei futures had slipped 50 points to 20,350.
